result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron Andre Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and school.

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

Random screening.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron Andre Hopkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and school.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) obtain GED. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies motion for expungement.

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment.  Defense received a new offer and wants to review it with the defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motins to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/22/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 44.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer today.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case scheduled for 8:30 am.  Defendant was the first one to check in.  Attorney Dluzak was was unable to come this morning.  Case passed to the afternoon.  Attorney Dluzak informed the court that the defendant had to go to work, and was unable to appear.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 5/28/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Ronald Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/8/15.

15RM022938  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Byron Andre Hopkins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
